page.title: 01WADENHOE BLOCK SUMMARY
page.content: In the Wadenhoe area the main type of land use is for farm crops other than grass, followed by enclosed rough grazing. The land overall is not built up although there are the villages of Aldwincle, Lilford,Pilton and Wadenhoe.The population figures from 1981 were :- Aldwincle 310, Lilford 79, Pilton 62, and Wadenhoe 101. As you can see from the above figures the population of the area is only 542. There are not a lot of amenities in the area, but there is the local river Nene, where boating,swimming, canoeing, fishing and walking can take place.There is also Lilford Park with its wide selection of animals ranging from mice to horses and from budgies to vultures. If you want a day out there then you could spend it by the Wadenhoe riverside near the pub and church picnicking.
